block.p: Katherine Lauren Shutzer, a daughter of Dr. Fay L. Shutzer and William A. Shutzer of New York, was married last evening to James Francis Brennan Jr., the son of Judge Brennan Sr. and Mrs. Brennan of Ramsey, N.J. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated at the University Club in New York. The Rev. George S. Salzmann of the Harvard Catholic Chaplaincy took part in the ceremony.
The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 25, graduated from Dartmouth College, where they met.

Katherine Lauren Shutzer, a daughter of Dr. Fay L. Shutzer and William A. Shutzer of New York, was married last evening to James Francis Brennan Jr., the son of Judge Brennan Sr. and Mrs. Brennan of Ramsey, N.J. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated at the University Club in New York. The Rev. George S. Salzmann of the Harvard Catholic Chaplaincy took part in the ceremony.
The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 25, graduated from Dartmouth College, where they met.

Mrs. Brennan, who received a master's degree in teaching from Boston University, teaches English at the Kent Place School in Summit, N.J. Her father is a New York-based partner in Thomas Weisel Partners, a San Francisco investment banking firm. Her mother, a psychologist, practices in New York.

Mr. Brennan, who received a law degree from Harvard University, is a law clerk to Judge Joseph M. McLaughlin of the Federal Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in New York. His father is a municipal court judge in Teterboro, N.J., and the borough attorney for Ramsey, where he also has a private practice.
